review: Well its been over a month now and I can say that I really like this device. The Apple TV is used strictly for streaming my Itunes library and the occasional IPad stream. The Fire is fast and the HD is outstanding. I could care less for the voice recognition but when we have used it it is working as intended.With the update of Amazon music library I would really like to see more options. At this point I have to scroll through my library in a inefficient way to get to what I want. I am still waiting for the Prime update to sift through what is Prime free and what is not. There is room for advancement no doubt which is why I gave it four out of five stars. With more enhanced improvements I see no reason to use anything else. We don't subscribe to cable and could care less for pay per view. We stream Hulu Plus and Netflix, our music, and free Prime programming. Its a win/win and did I mention this device is blazing fast? it literally kills our Apple TV.Fix the things people have been asking for like above and you'll get five stars from me Amazon.

review: The Amazon Fire TV is as advertised. It is a simple to use streaming media player with simple setup and easy to use remote. I would recommend using a Ethernet cable to connect it to your router/modem instead of going wirelessly however, as this allows unlimited speed for streaming instead of having it capped at 1.5 MB/s, which is not enough for some of the services like Hulu Plus. You will find a stutter effect if you do not, or a low quality picture.Other than that small hiccup, the Fire TV does as it says, works well, and the emerging lineup of apps available will only grow with time. Give it a chance if you are looking for an alternative to the Apple TV. I did, and I am pleased with the results.
